metadata.title: CVE-2016-9147 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
named in ISC BIND 9.9.9-P4, 9.9.9-S6, 9.10.4-P4, and 9.11.0-P1 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemonexit) via a response containing an inconsistency among the DNSSEC-relatedRRsets.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.4').
